TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract BitmapDecoder extends System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherObject

Docs.summary: Represents a container for bitmap frames. Each bitmap frame is a . This abstract class provides a base set of functionality for all derived decoder objects.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder> is not a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame> itself; rather, it is a container for <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame> objects. Each <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame> in the container can potentially have different attributes, including different sizes, resolutions, or palettes.
Unless a specific codec is selected, [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] uses automatic run-time discovery to identify the format of an image and match it with the appropriate codec. This discovery process allows a codec developed by an [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_isv](~/includes/tlasharptla-isv-md.md)] to be automatically discoverable by the system. To select a specific codec, the derived <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapEncoder>, such as the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TiffBitmapDecoder> class, should be used.
[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_tiff](~/includes/tlasharptla-tiff-md.md)] and [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gif](~/includes/tlasharptla-gif-md.md)] are the only implemented image formats that support multiple frames.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder.Create%28System.Uri%2CSystem.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions%2CSystem.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption%29> method to create a decoder for a given image. The first <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame> of the image is used as the source of an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Image> control.
[!code-csharp[imagingsnippetgallery_procedural_snip#BitmapDecoderCreate](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ImagingSnippetGallery_procedural_snip/CSharp/BitmapDecoderExample.cs#bitmapdecodercreate)] [!code-vb[imagingsnippetgallery_procedural_snip#BitmapDecoderCreate](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ImagingSnippetGallery_procedural_snip/VB/BitmapDecoderExample.vb#bitmapdecodercreate)]
The following code example demonstrates how to use the built in <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TiffBitmapDecoder> to open and decode a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_tiff](~/includes/tlasharptla-tiff-md.md)] bitmap. The resulting <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> is used as the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Image.Source%2A> of an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Image> element.
[!code-csharp[bitmapframeexample#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/CSharp/BitmapFrame.cs#4)] [!code-vb[bitmapframeexample#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/VB/BitmapFrame.vb#4)]

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder Create (System.IO.Stream bitmapStream, System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions createOptions, System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption cacheOption);

.method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder Create(class System.IO.Stream bitmapStream, valuetype System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions createOptions, valuetype System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption cacheOption) cil managed

Docs.param: The file stream that identifies the bitmap to decode.
Docs.summary: Creates a from a by using the specified and .
Docs.returns: A from a by using the specified and .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption> cache option if you wish to close the `bitmapStream` after the decoder is created. The default <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption> cache option retains access to the stream until the bitmap is needed, and cleanup is handled by the garbage collector.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder.Create%2A> method to create a decoder for a given image. The first <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame> of the image is used as the source of an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Image> control.
[!code-csharp[imagingsnippetgallery_procedural_snip#BitmapDecoderCreateStream](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ImagingSnippetGallery_procedural_snip/CSharp/BitmapDecoderExample.cs#bitmapdecodercreatestream)] [!code-vb[imagingsnippetgallery_procedural_snip#BitmapDecoderCreateStream](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ImagingSnippetGallery_procedural_snip/VB/BitmapDecoderExample.vb#bitmapdecodercreatestream)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Finalize() cil managed

Docs.summary: Frees resources and performs other cleanup operations before the is reclaimed by garbage collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method overrides <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A>. Application code should not call this method; an object's `Finalize` method is automatically invoked during garbage collection, unless finalization by the garbage collector has been disabled by a call to the <xref:System.GC.SuppressFinalize%2A> method.
For more information, see [Finalize Methods and Destructors](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/fd376774-1643-499b-869e-9546a3aeea70), [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md), and [Overriding the Finalize Method](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/8026cb68-fe93-43fc-96c1-c09ad7d64cd3).

Docs.permission: for access to unmanaged resources. Security action:. Associated enumeration:

Docs.summary: Gets the content of an individual frame within a bitmap.
Docs.value: An instance of . This property has no default value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Only [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_tiff](~/includes/tlasharptla-tiff-md.md)] and [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gif](~/includes/tlasharptla-gif-md.md)] images support more than one frame.
Any <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame> objects returned by this property are frozen.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame> as a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource>.
[!code-csharp[bitmapframeexample#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/CSharp/BitmapFrame.cs#4)] [!code-vb[bitmapframeexample#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/VB/BitmapFrame.vb#4)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates if the decoder is currently downloading content.
Docs.value: if the decoder is downloading content; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets an instance of that represents the global metadata associated with this bitmap, if metadata is defined.
Docs.value: An instance of that represents global metadata associated with a bitmap. If no metadata is defined, this property returns .

remarks.format: ## Remarks None of the built-in derived <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder> classes support global metadata. Metadata should be added to the individual frames of an image.

Docs.summary: Gets the associated with this decoder.
Docs.value: The associated with this decoder. If the bitmap has no palette, is returned. This property has no default value.

Docs.summary: Gets a that represents the global preview of this bitmap, if one is defined.
Docs.value: A that represents the global preview of the bitmap. If no preview is defined, this property returns . This property has no default value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> returned by this property is frozen.

Docs.summary: Gets a that represents the thumbnail of the bitmap, if one is defined.
Docs.value: A that represents a thumbnail of the bitmap. If no thumbnail is defined, this property returns . This property has no default value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks None of the native formats support global thumbnails. [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_jpegorg](~/includes/tlasharptla-jpegorg-md.md)], [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_tiff](~/includes/tlasharptla-tiff-md.md)], and [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_wdp](~/includes/tlasharptla-wdp-md.md)] support frame-level thumbnails that can be accessed using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame.Thumbnail%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> returned by this property is frozen.
